body:
**Is this a bug report or feature request?**
* Bug Report

**Deviation from expected behavior:**

When trying to upgrade the rook-ceph helm chart from 1.3.1 to 1.3.2, helm is failing with the following error,

```
dry-run upgrade for comparison failed: rendered manifests contain a new resource that already exists. Unable to continue with update: existing resource conflict: namespace: , name: psp:rook, existing_kind: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1, Kind=ClusterRole, new_kind: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1, Kind=ClusterRole" phase=dry-run-compare
```

If I manually delete the `ClusterRole/psp:rook`, the helm, upgrade will now proceed without error,

e.g. `kubectl -n rook-ceph delete clusterrole psp:rook`

Speculation that [this recent change](https://github.com/rook/rook/pull/5297/files#diff-86424e092115d22f58b9822e799d8fbcR500) may be related to the source of the error given that this behavior has not occurred with previous helm upgrades of the rook-ceph chart.

**Expected behavior:**

Helm upgrades would progress without error.

**Environment**:
* OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): `k3os`
* Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): `Linux k3s-0 5.0.0-43-generic #47~18.04.1 SMP Wed Apr 1 16:27:01 UTC 2020 x86_64 GNU/Linux`
* Cloud provider or hardware configuration: `bare metal`
* Rook version (use `rook version` inside of a Rook Pod): `1.3.1`
* Storage backend version (e.g. for ceph do `ceph -v`): `ceph version 14.2.6 (f0aa067ac7a02ee46ea48aa26c6e298b5ea272e9) nautilus (stable)`
* Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
* Kubernetes cluster type (e.g. Tectonic, GKE, OpenShift): `k3s`
* Storage backend status (e.g. for Ceph use `ceph health` in the [Rook Ceph toolbox](https://rook.io/docs/rook/master/ceph-toolbox.html)): `HEALTH_OK`
title: ceph: upgrading helm chart from 1.3.1 to 1.3.2 fails
